caption: The spot is extraordinary and roomy, the food was delightful and the rates were very reasonable. fast, efficient service and very amiable staff. Highly recommended.

I often take my friends to this restaurant with my highest recommendations. I  go to this restaurant often. I get very good feedback from my friends. The meals are appetizing and the stuff is very friendly and cooperative. Whenever we go to this place we have a splendid time.  warmly recommended.

BEWARE!!! This review has nothing to do with the food (I had the Penang curry and it is great). On February 26 round 6 pm, I presented my card for purchase. The young woman held on to my card for an extended period of time making a fuss over the register as if there was an error. As I waited, I inquired to my sister (whom I was speaking with via earphones) why the young woman had not given my card back yet as she dealt with the register. Finally, card returned, I signed for my meal and left. The following day, by 4:00 pm, I had over $350 in fraudulent purchases on my credit card. Luckily, my bank caught all of these purchases and all is well on my end. However, the Thai Kitchen was the only establishment where I had relinquished my card to someone for payment and, notably, that person held onto it for an extended period of time (under the circumstances). Since the fraud, I have attempted to speak with the manager or owner about the incident, both in-person and over the phone, and have been given the run around. If there is a security breach I wanted the business to know. I left my business card as well. But, I was met with resistance: No one will speak with me. I have been told that the manager's name is "Manager" and that the workers are unable to release his name.
Great food, and it's always ready and waiting which makes me feel better minimizing contact. Also love the option to adjust the spiciness of every item you get. Overall great place highly recommend.
The spot is excellent and broad, the food was yummy and the rates were very affordable. fast, effective service and very friendly staff members. I recommend this place.

I celebrated my birthday last night in this great restaurant. happy to tell that we passed a tremendous evening and the venue was absolutely one of the reasons for the strong event. The team  cooperated in a graceful manner, the cuisine was delicious and my buddies were so  thrilled. We shall no dout come back again for more events. Thank you very much.
Take out at this restaurant ALWAYS takes forever
One of the slowest restaurant ever in town Waited 1 hrs for one item Lots of people cancle order and went back Need to improve a lot ..worse experience
This restaurant is great and broad, the food was enchanting and the rates were very inexpensive. rapidly, efficient service and very affable staff. I recommend this place.
This spot never fails to impress. They serve awesome dishes for fair pricing, there is no waiting time even when the place is busy.

Pretty good. Cheaper than Bangkok Garden, with about the same portion size but less meat. The taste with Thai Kitchen is better though. The pad thai actually tasted like pad thai.  The reason I give this one a 3 stars instead of 4 is because our order wasn't ready on time. We ordered through Doordash instead of their website, and I guess they don't check that source as often or something? The order was supposed to be done 5:58pm, we got there at 6pm but the order wasn't there. The lady did some checking and finally found the order about 5 minutes in. Told us it would be about 30 minutes. We went off to do some errands, came back, and the order was ready.  Will go again if in the craving for cheap Thai food, and will make sure to use the store's website.

I went to pick up food for a customer. I noticed that one of the cooks in back didn't have his mask over his face. I brought it to the manager attention and she tried to over look it while I was talking to her. Be mindful to all who order food from this restaurant. When place an order over the phone. Please ask them are the staff and cooks practicing the Cdc guidelines?
Very bad service waited 40 min to pick up order
Definitely a spot worth stopping by, the food is awesome and well prepared, the rates are fair and it is regularly neat in here. 5 stars.

Worst over the phone customer service ever!!! If I could give it zero stars I would! We needed to cancel our order because we weren’t going to make it there. They said that they could not give us a refund because they had already made the food which is unacceptable we were not going to make it there to eat our food and could not get a refund! Not to mention after we told her the situation she said sorry it’s the policy and hung up the phone and will not pick up again! I’m sure the food is great but they have terrible customer service! Never coming here again!
The place offers a vast range of fresh food. I like dining here. Employees are always very friendly, prices are fair and the place is always neat.

We came to this place for lunch. we heard about this place from a lot of people.  Well, it was a winning. we were warmly welcomed by the staff  and we had an excellent feeling. The meal was delicious. We enjoyed every moment and we will definitely return to this restaurant. Keep it up.

Ordered for carry out. They said 1/2 hour. Took over an hour, to get the food though. Others were waiting a long time too. Idk if this is typical or not for this business. Overall the food was fine, but not fantastic. I think I would try a different place e next time.
I adore this restaurant a lot. there is a nice atmosphere. The food is splendid. the service is efficient and the personel is polite. The price is satisfactory. I definitely recommend.
Fantastic place to have something when in a hurry. The service is quick, pricing is affordable, excellent character. Will visit here again

Ordered panang curry delivery. It was supposed to have cabbage, basil, and bamboo shoots. It had three tiny strips of cabbage, two strips of basil, no bamboo. All together the veggies were less than a bite full. The panang also tastes weird. I couldn't eat it. Won't be ordering from here again.
We had a fantastic experience at this restaurant. We loved the fantastic ambience and the food. The staff were very welcoming. I’m happy we finally managed to visit here.
Wonderful
This spot gives superb service as well as enjoyable food. My favourite spot around here. The meals arrived rapidly and the prices were fair. Highly recommended.

This restaurant is my favored. I go to plenty of restaurants but to this one I go the most. The team is very helpful and the food they place on your table is so tasty. I am always happy to have a decent dinner in this place. Highly recommended.
From time to time the waits are pretty long. However, even when I think I waited a long time for my food, once I do start eating it always feels worth the wait.
Great food. Small. A little slow.  But great food.

Messed up my order and I took it straight home and was so excited to eat my Pad See ew and then took out to find pad Thai! I live far away so didn’t feel like driving a half hour back to correct it. Also the pot stickers are the tiniest pot stickers I’ve ever seen.
This place is way too busy on a Saturday

Food is way too spicy to point of being inedible. I like spicy food and frequently order Thai, Chinese, Indian, etc. Noodle dish here was just unpleasant and flavors were overwhelmed by the heat. Had takeout from 4-5 Thai restaurants in area that was still spicy but at least edible and enjoyable.

I ordered the Drunken Noodles medium spicy (on a scale of not spicy, medium spicy, and spicy) and the dish was practically inedible; my mouth was on fire in an unpleasant way. Normally, I am a big fan of spicy foods (Thai, Korean, Indian), but this was too much. I also had several of my housemates try the dish as well to confirm that I wasn't overreacting, and they too said it burned in a very unpleasant way. The noodles and chicken itself was very tasty, but I just wanted to warn others of the spiciness.
Quick access and a simple menu
This is an awesome place with tons of gluten free options very tasty
The meat isn't good.  Both the chicken and beef are very tough.  We enjoyed the dumplings and rice noodles.
The curry chicken was bomb😁
Pot stickers delicious. Drunken noodles delicious too. Fried rice is good enough. It's above average Thai food and the fact that it's quick makes it fantastic.
Delicious, affordable, quick. Thai Kitchen is a great little place.
A great Bethesda budget option. Love their Pad Thai. Their mango sweet rice is also pretty great. My husband also likes the Basil Fried Rice.
Very tasty a reasonably priced!  Portions are on the larger side but I am sure that works great for everyone.
It was really good would go back again.
Nice Thai food.

Have never written a review before. Just had the massamon curry. It was the worst curry I’ve ever had, and I eat a lot of curry. Tasted literally like the peanut dipping sauce used for satay with 4 pieces of semi raw potatoes and shrimp. To be fair I only had this dish. I have eaten here once before and was not impressed then but decided to try again.
It is one of the best Thai restaurants where we have eaten.

Overall I really do find this place a good value for quick carry out option. Their noodle and curry dishes are more than adequate. You have to spice them up a bit with the condiments they provide on the side but otherwise I come back for those dishes.  However, the stir fry I got recently was just awful. I got the Ku prow which is usually a standard beef option at similar Thai places.  It was like a very watery beef with basil and onions dish. I mean it was just bland and unappetizing. I had to drown it in soy sauce just to salvage it.  They really need to put some work into making this dish better or work on their quality control, because for now on I am not going to risk trying anything from the stir fry section.  Again  a good value restaurant that I think caters too much to the bland pallets of bougie elite people in the area. Might need more quality control.  Stick to the curry and noodles.
Nice coustmer service,but  food  test change every single.

We really enjoyed the food and the portion sizes are very fair for the price. What ruined the experience for my family was the fact that we were finishing our meals almost 20 minutes before they closed, and they started turning off lights and bringing out cleaning supplies and poured bleach on the floor. The strong smell immediately made my husband's stomach upset so he took our 2 year old and waited outside while we packed up the remainder of our food in to-go boxes. It was really off putting and we all left feeling a bit queasy. They turned someone away who came in and wanted to place a to-go order 15 min before closing. They should post signage on the door that states they won't accept dine-in orders an hour before closing.
Love their larb gai, pas thai, and several appetizers. Very good quality for the price
Affordable Thai restaurant in Bethesda just north of Bradley Blvd.
Very fast. Excellent dishes. The best items are the stir fry and rice dishes. Can get crowded
Food took 20 extra minutes than time told
Great , healthy food at decent prices. I have seen great improvement in my cancer condition since eating there. I encourage everyone interested in a healthy lifestyle to try their food.
By far the best Thai restaurant in eastern Prince William

I came in during lunch hour last Friday. There wasn't a line but some customers waiting for their orders. I was standing at the counter for about a minute to be waited on. The cashier proceeded to come back to the counter, did not acknowledge me and proceeded to talk to a customer behind me in line and asked her if she was ready to order. I believe both myself and the customer behind me were shocked. The customer behind me proceeded to state I was waiting before her. The cashier did not apologize or offer a reason for overlooking. I addressed her about her lacking customer service and asked to speak with the owner. The owner indicated she was busy with cooking orders! Anyway, the  lemongrass soup was pretty good. So much for customer service...
Got drunken noodles! So good!! Smiley staff and good pricing.
Very good be addition to community

Decided to try this new place, was delighted on how fresh and tasty the food was. This is not meant as much of a sit down restaurant, only few 2 people tables and more cold feeling like ambience likely good for lunch for businesses around, but the food was delicious and staff friendly and helpful. This meant for more take out but delicious and fresh! Parking is right around the back in the open lot parking space. We will be sure to return for pick up, there are no Thai options in Bethesda other than the old Bethesda, you have to venture out to Rockville or Silver Spring. Recommend you give it a try for pick up and you would not regret. I’m rooting for this place as I feel especially this part of Bethesda has lost much of its support for small businesses likely due to high rent. Enjoy!

I went there for lunch. Order was easy and i found a table by myself. They quickly brought out my food in few minutes. It was decent like other thai restaurant. I think their setup is efficient, food is good, service is in line with this type of restaurant. However, when i tried to place an order over the phone, it was not possible. They don't have menu on a website or yelp. I called to ask and was told it is on facebook. However, it was a poor quality photo copy that is not readable. I was told to go in to place order and wait for it. Well, they are not that good for my taking too much time to do so. I actually ended up cooked my own delicious meal with my friend. They just lost 2 customers. We don't feel like to go back any time soon.
So happy this place landed here. Delicious, fresh, wonderful.
Very casual with very good food. I had the Massuman Curry with beef; that dish had a 0-chilli spicy rating but was very flavorful with just a hint of heat (I know how spicy Thai food can get).
Awesome food, awesome service. One of my new favorites!
Some of the best Thai food I’ve had in the DC area. The pad thai and green curry were both tasty and the Mango sticky rice was fresh and delicious.
Great prices, great food. love it!
Decent prices, good portions, food is decent, and they offer allergen info and foods. Hope they stick around
Had Panang curry.  Very flavorful.   It was Saturday, so wait for food was 30 minutes.   I will come again.

I've been waiting my entire adult life for a fast casual (counter service), authentic Thai restaurant like this!  The food was delicious, service was excellent, and prices extremely affordable for downtown Bethesda - pretty much any entree (including meat) is $10.  They even have the water cups and water tank out in the dining area, which is a huge plus in my book.  The only thing is that there are only about 8 or 10 tables, only a couple of which were four-tops (though most of the remaining two-tops can also be converted to four-tops), so I can imagine that it may be difficult to get a table during busy times, and there is no outdoor seating due to limited space on the sidewalk.  That's really the only drawback I can think of, though.  This place is already my new go-to!
